question: Are there tools for visualizing and processing long-read sequencing data?
ideal_answer: Yes. Tools such as NanoPack for instance have been developed for visualization and processing of long-read sequencing data from Oxford Nanopore Technologies and Pacific Biosciences.

snippets.text: NanoPack: visualizing and processing long-read sequencing data.

Here we describe NanoPack, a set of tools developed for visualization and processing of long-read sequencing data from Oxford Nanopore Technologies and Pacific Biosciences.Availability and implementation: The NanoPack tools are written in Python3 and released under the GNU GPL3.0 License. The source code can be found at https://github.com/wdecoster/nanopack, together with links to separate scripts and their documentation. The scripts are compatible with Linux, Mac OS and the MS Windows 10 subsystem for Linux and are available as a graphical user interface, a web service at http://nanoplot.bioinf.be and command line tools.

Summary
Here we describe NanoPack, a set of tools developed for visualization and processing of long-read sequencing data from Oxford Nanopore Technologies and Pacific Biosciences.
NanoPack: visualizing and processing long-read sequencing data.Supplementary data are available at Bioinformatics online.
